text: James Nallen (born 1973 in Castlebar) is an All Star winning Gaelic footballer for Mayo. He played in five All-Ireland finals, including an All-Ireland final replay against Meath in 1996, and won two All Stars, in 1996 and 2004. He won a National Football League medal in 2001. However, he never won an All-Ireland medal. He retired from inter-county football in 2010. At club level Nallen had much success with Crossmolina, winning Mayo Senior Football Championships in 1995, 1999, 2000, 2002, 2005 and 2006, as well as Connacht Senior Club Football Championships in 1999, 2000, 2002 and an All-Ireland Senior Club Football Championship in 2001. He has also been a selector for Mayo. He is Chief Technical Officer at NUI Galway's School of Physics NUI Galway. ==References== Category:1973 births Category:Living people Category:Claregalway Gaelic footballers Category:Crossmolina Gaelic footballers Category:Gaelic football selectors Category:Mayo inter-county Gaelic footballers Category:People associated with NUI Galway Category:People from Castlebar
title: James Nallen
